item.title: Linux Filesystem Directory Structure
item.author: Author
item.description: Unlike other operating systems, in linux everything starts from /. This is called root directory. You can use cd command to navigate in filesystem. If you’re inside some directory and you want to know where you’re inside the directory tree, just type pwd and it will show you the current working directory. pwd stands for print working directory. cd command needs some arguments if you want to visit some other directory.
